page.title: 11FARMS BOURTON-ON-DUNSMORE
page.content: IN{BOURTON}THERE ARE TWO FARMS, {GATE FARM}AND{HOME FARM.}BOTH FARMS KEEP SHEEP AS THEIR MAIN ANIMALS. THE BIGGER FARM IS{HOME FARM,}WHICH IS OPPOSITE THE CHURCH. AT ONE TIME THIS FARM WAS CALLED CHURCH FARM BUT SOMETIME DURING THE LAST FORTY YEARS ITS NAME CHANGED, TO HOME FARM. THE LAND AROUND BOURTON IS FAIRLY EVENLY DIVIDED BETWEEN CROPS AND GRAZING LAND. THE MAIN CROPS ARE{WHEAT}AND {RAPE}WHICH ARE SOLD TO BE USED FOR FOOD, E.G. MARGARINE AND FLOUR. THE LOCAL FARMERS KEEP THEIR OWN ANIMALS, MAINLY{SHEEP WITH A FEW COWS}ON THE GRAZING LAND.
